title: [Neuroscience] Why the memory of fear is seared into our brains : Norepinephrine causes a bursting pattern of electrical activity, which changes the frequency of brain wave patterns in a region of the brain known as Amygdala from a resting state to an aroused state, that promotes the formation of Fear Memories

[Medicine] Researchers identify rise in Guillain-Barr√© syndrome following AstraZeneca vaccine: Overall, following a first dose of AstraZeneca vaccine there were 5.8 excess GBS cases per million doses of vaccine. First doses of Pfizer and Moderna and second doses of any vaccination showed no excess GBS risk.
